subject: Re: [Re: [Re: [junit] Junit & I18N]]
msgSnippet: ... Yes and no. Well it should, but I have no idea what DBCS is... Johannes DBCS stands for Double Byte Character Set, it is commonly used to indicate those
messageBody:
"Johannes Link" <john.link@...> wrote:

> ---------------------------------------------
> Attachment:�
> MIME Type:�multipart/alternative
> ---------------------------------------------

> Thanks Johannes,
> I wasn't thinking of any particular enablement, just I was wondering if
> the tool could work on "strange" environments, as well as the DBCS ones. I
> argue from your answer that it actually should (?).

Yes and no. Well it should, but I have no idea what DBCS is...

Johannes

DBCS stands for Double Byte Character Set, it is commonly used to indicate
those countries using ideographic languages that cannot use Single Byte
Character Set (SBCS). Most programs have problems in these environments if not
specifically tested. I tried Junit (the text version) and it seems to work
fine....

ciao, Attilio
